alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 5:18AM EDT until June 12 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 600 AM EDT/500 AM CDT/. * At 518 AM EDT/418 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Abbeville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Blakely, Bellville, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Hayes, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Pecan, Graball, Thomas Mill Creek, Early Co A/p, Jones Crossing, Bethel, Suttons Corner and Fort Gaines-Clay Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
